oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Knoxville man_father of smokies park_will see dream made true by president
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A newspaper article pertaining to the dedication of the Great Smoky Mountains National Park and the visit President Roosevelt made to the area.

In September of 1940, President Franklin D. Roosevelt came to East Tennessee to officially dedicate the Great Smoky Mountains National Park. The President delivered his address at Newfound Gap at the main crest of the mountains that serves as a boundary between Tennessee and North Carolina.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Great Smoky Mountains National Park (N.C. and Tenn.)
Newspapers
